project_abstract.cdata: The Emergency Reintegration and Recovery Credit Project (ERRC) is part of the effort by the Bank to play a constructive role in international efforts at reconstruction and rapid economic recovery, peace and stability in Rwanda and the Great Lakes Region generally. The project will ensure that the Government is able to provide basic services to returning refugees and the existing population, and consolidate the economic recovery and stability already underway. By providing foreign exchange for imports, ERRC will enhance private sector production and employment which will reinforce the reintegration effort. The project will finance a positive list of imports important for reintegration, reconstruction and continued economic recovery. The list of eligible imports is as follows: live animals for breeding; seed grains and fruits and spores for planting; oil and chemical oil products; sugar and industrial glucose; petroleum coke and jelly; inorganic chemical products; hydrocarbons and derivatives; pharmaceuticals; fertilizers; inks and toners; basic oils; artificial wax; insecticides, herbicides, etc.; plastic and cellulose products; rubber products; wood and wood products; paper and paper products (books, etc.); cotton; synthetic fibers; ceramic products; glass; iron and steel; copper; nickel; aluminum; lead; zinc; motors; telephones and radiophone equipment; cars, tractors, cycles, etc.; photocopiers and printers; topographical, geodesic and mathematical instruments; medical instruments; gas, liquid or electrical meters; and office equipment.
